events.name: Special Talk With Andreas Antonopoulos
events.description:
School of accountancy is the building right in front of Fort Canning, on the left of the National Art Gallery. There's a Swissbake right at the lobby. 



March 20th, we'll have a special guest in town, Andreas M. Antonopoulos! He'll be sharing his thoughts on the future of money with the Singapore community.  Andreas M. Antonopoulos is a technologist and serial entrepreneur who has become one of the most well-known and well-respected figures in bitcoin. He is the author of two books: “Mastering Bitcoin”, published by O’Reilly Media and considered the best technical guide to bitcoin and “The Internet of Money”, a book about why bitcoin matters. 


As an engaging public speaker, teacher and writer,  Andreas makes complex subjects accessible and easy to understand. As an advisor, he helps startups recognize, evaluate, and navigate security and business risks. Andreas was also one of the first to use the phrase “The Internet of Money”, as early as 2013, to describe bitcoin as part of his speaking business. 


As a bitcoin entrepreneur, Andreas has founded a number of bitcoin businesses and launched several community open-source projects. He is a widely published author of articles and blog posts on bitcoin, is a permanent host on the popular Let’s Talk Bitcoin Podcast, and a frequent speaker at technology and security conferences worldwide. 


You can find out more and watch some of his past events at https://antonopoulos.com/ This event is being co-organized with the Ethereum Singapore Meetup, and sponsored by ACCESS, The Singapore Blockchain and Cryptocurrency Association http://www.access-sg.org/ 6:[masked] Food - Check-in 7:00 Seating 7.25 Introduction 7.30 Talk Starts 8.00 Q&A 8.15 Community Networking 8.45 Closing PLEASE RSVP TO RESERVE YOUR SPOT!!!! Event Sponsor:   http://www.access-sg.org/  


Refreshments Sponsors:  https://coss.io/  https://www.coinhako.com/  http://sage-insights.com/ 



Venue Support:   https://skbi.smu.edu.sg Cheers, Bitcoin Singapore and Ethereum Singapore
events.location: Singapore Management University - Ngee Ann Kongsi Auditorium, Level 2, SMU School of Accountancy , 60 Stamford Road Singapore, 178900

events.name: Ethereum Singapore & Bitcoin SG: Andreas Antonopoulos Keynote on Future of Money
events.description:
Hello fellow Etherians, Once again, it's proving to be an event packed first quarter of 2017. Together with Bitcoin SG, with the sponsorship of ACCESS, we are proud to bring you Andreas Antonopoulos and a keynote special on his thoughts on the future of money. Andreas M. Antonopoulos is a technologist and serial entrepreneur who has become one of the most well-known and well-respected figures in bitcoin. He is the author of two books: “Mastering Bitcoin”, published by O’Reilly Media and considered the best technical guide to bitcoin and “The Internet of Money”, a book about why bitcoin matters. As an engaging public speaker, teacher and writer,  Andreas makes complex subjects accessible and easy to understand. As an advisor, he helps startups recognize, evaluate, and navigate security and business risks. Andreas was also one of the first to use the phrase “The Internet of Money”, as early as 2013, to describe bitcoin as part of his speaking business. As a bitcoin entrepreneur, Andreas has founded a number of bitcoin businesses and launched several community open-source projects. He is a widely published author of articles and blog posts on bitcoin, is a permanent host on the popular Let’s Talk Bitcoin Podcast, and a frequent speaker at technology and security conferences worldwide. You can find out more and watch some of his past events at https://antonopoulos.com/ This event is being co-organized with the Bitcoin Singapore Meetup, and sponsored by ACCESS, The Singapore Blockchain and Cryptocurrency Association http://www.access-sg.org/ Timeline of event day: 6:[masked] Food - Check-in 7:00 Seating 7.25 Introduction 7.30 Talk Starts 8.00 Q&A 8.15 Community Networking 8.45 Closing References:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=esM1i_iNCjw&ab_channel=BitcoinTV http://www.forbes.com/sites/laurashin/2016/08/23/blockchain-101-with-andreas-antonopoulos-how-bitcoin-makes-each-of-us-as-powerful-as-a-bank/#38d9825f34fd Please RSVP to the SKBI mailing list as well for registration purposes (up soon),  Event Sponsor:   http://www.access-sg.org/ Refreshments Sponsors:  https://coss.io/  https://www.coinhako.com/  http://sage-insights.com/ 



Venue Support:  https://skbi.smu.edu.sg Cheers, Ethereum Singapore and Bitcoin SG
events.location: Singapore Management University - Ngee Ann Kongsi Auditorium, Level 2, SMU School of Accountancy , 60 Stamford Road Singapore, 178900

events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:45p - Introduce projects from members6:55p - Break out into groups7:00p - Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: TensorFlow and Deep Learning: 2nd Event
events.description:
After our kick-off event in February, we're going to maintain the idea of having something for beginner users, and something for more advanced folk - but we're not going to repeat the very basics... We plan to have three sections to cover the range of experience that we hope will attend :  1.  Working with Images : CNN models will be introduced by Martin, from the basics.  And, if there's time we'll delve into ways to fool the network...   2.  Since he's in Singapore for FOSSASIA (a huge Open Source event this coming weekend), we've been able to grab Andrew Selle (from the Google Brain team) to talk about the work he's involved in.  Expect to hear about XLA and other techniques to speed up TensorFlow. 3.  For the regular "aiming higher" talk, Sam will explain the basics of one of the current hot topics : Generative models  and Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), including some quirky variations. 


Coming soon : "Lightning Talks" - where we welcome folks to come up and talk about something cool they've done with TensorFlow and/or Deep Learning for 5-10mins (if you have slides, then #max=10).  The key for the Lightning Talks slot is simply the cool/interesting factor.  It doesn't matter whether you're an expert or and enthusiastic beginner : Given the response we had to the last event, we're sure there are lots of people who would be interested to hear what you've been playing with.  Please suggest yourself here : https://www.meetup.com/TensorFlow-and-Deep-Learning-Singapore/suggestion/ Quite a few people have already contacted us, but we know there are more out there!  Because Andrew Selle was added to the line-up at this late stage, we'll give everyone a bit more time (i.e. until the MeetUp in April...) 


Also, since we *won't* have food, please plan to grab a bite before/after the event...
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, , Singapore

events.name: Fab Meetup: Exploring the Future of Our Past with Technology (20 March)
events.description:
Fab Meetup: Exploring the Future of Our Past with Technology
Featuring Tatjana Dzambazova

Autodesk’s Technology Whisperer, Tatjana Dzambazova, is passionate about democratizing novel approaches for digital heritage preservation using technology, and turning them into immersive and interactive experiences of people of all ages.
Join us to hear about Tatjana’s journey – from digitizing coral reefs, scanning the Apollo 11, studying and 3D printing ancient baroque topologies – and how we can explore the future of our past with technology.




Bucephalus, horse of Alexander the great. Made by Tatjana Dzambazova with Autodesk Remake 





Venue: FabCafe, lobby of ArtScience Museum
Date: Monday, 20 March 2017
Time: 1930 - 2200 
Ages: 7 - 100+ 
Free of charge. Limited to 65 tickets (*We've increased the number of seats from 40 to 65 to accommodate possible no-shows.)
Please be considerate and refund the ticket if you plan on not turning up. Give your seat up to folks who are interested. 
Participants can enjoy 10% off pastries, food and drinks at FabCafe.



Tatjana Dzambazova 
Technology Whisperer, Autodesk

Tatjana Dzambazova spent the first decade of her career working as a trained architect and in the design industry in Vienna and London. Fascinated by the impact that technology has on our lives, she decided to continue her career in the digital design technology world, and she has been working for Autodesk for the last 16 years. 
An avid believer that we are all born with a sense for creativity and innovation and the need to express it, Tatjana focuses her energy on helping make and promote powerful novel digital design technologies in a way that is accessible to wide range of new audiences. Her work developing Autodesk ReCap and ReMake has seen her leading and producing the Smithsonian-Autodesk collaborative project, The Smithsonian 3D Explorer (an interactive web/mobile/VR experience created with Autodesk’s Project Play technology), and acting as technology consultant of many customer initiatives such as AfricaFossils.org.
Tatjana is a passionate technology speaker, some of her notable talks involve TEDx ‘The Future of our Past’ and the short film for the Future of Storytelling (FoST) conference. She is based in San Francisco.


Meetup Partner
events.location: FabCafe, Lobby of ArtScience Museum, 6 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018974
